intro: Flueggea elliptica, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, featuring thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by capsules containing numerous seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its botanical characteristics make it a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping and ecological restoration projects.
